title: Java Stringtrim()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java Stringtrim()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Remove whitespace from both sides of a string:
String myStr = "       Hello World!       ";
System.out.println(myStr);
System.out.println(myStr.trim());

Definition and Usage
The
trim()
method removes whitespace from both ends of a string.
Note:
This method does not change the original string.
Syntax
public String trim()
Parameters
None.
Technical Details
Returns:
A
String
value, which is a copy of the string, without leading and trailing whitespace

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: Java Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is which?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of which is 'a copy of the string'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this java feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers Java Stringtrim()Method concepts and techniques. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java Stringtrim()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
